title: Bereavement Services UI
description:
Bereavement Services Tracking System

Build a HIPAA-compliant case management system for healthcare organizations to track and coordinate bereavement services for families of deceased patients, ensuring timely follow-up care and comprehensive documentation of grief support activities.

Core Functionality:

1. Case Management
- Create new bereavement cases linked to deceased patient records
- Capture essential patient information (name, date of death, service location, cause category)
- Assign cases to bereavement coordinators or counselors
- Track case status (active, closed, referred to external services)
- Advanced search and filtering (by date range, assigned staff, follow-up status, service type)

2. Family Contact Management
- Store primary contact information with validation (name, relationship to deceased, phone, email, mailing address)
- Support multiple family member contacts per case
- Record preferred contact method (phone, email, mail, in-person) and best times to reach
- Flag special considerations (language preference, cultural/religious needs, accessibility requirements)
- Maintain contact history with timestamps

3. Follow-Up Tracking System
- Schedule follow-up actions at standard intervals (72-hour, 30-day, 90-day, 1-year milestones)
- Create custom follow-up tasks with due dates and assigned staff
- Log completed interactions with detailed notes
- Document family needs assessment and emotional state observations
- Set automated reminders for upcoming and overdue follow-ups
- Mark tasks complete with required documentation
- Escalation workflow for families requiring additional support

4. Service and Resource Documentation
- Record services provided: counseling referrals, support group information, memorial service details, practical assistance
- Track resources shared: grief literature, community resources, financial assistance programs
- Document referrals to internal/external providers with follow-up status
- Maintain timeline view of all services and interactions per family

5. Reporting and Analytics
- Dashboard view of pending and overdue follow-ups by staff member
- Generate activity reports (outreach completed, services provided, families served) by date range
- Identify families requiring escalated support based on missed contacts or expressed needs
- Export data for quality improvement and compliance audits
- Metrics tracking: response times, completion rates, family satisfaction

6. HIPAA Compliance and Security
- Role-based access control (administrators, coordinators, view-only)
- Audit trail of all data access and modifications (who, when, what changed)
- Encrypted data storage for all family and patient information
- Secure authentication with password requirements
- Session timeout and automatic logout
- Compliance with minimum necessary standard for data access

7. User Interface Requirements
- Professional, calming design using muted, respectful color palette
- Compassionate language in labels and messaging
- Clear navigation between cases, contacts, and follow-up tasks
- Dashboard prioritizing urgent items (overdue follow-ups, recent intakes)
- Mobile-responsive design for staff accessing system remotely
- Accessibility compliance (WCAG 2.1 AA standards)

Success Criteria:
- System reduces missed follow-ups by providing automated reminders
- Staff can locate any case and its complete history within 30 seconds
- All bereavement interactions are documented consistently
- Audit logs demonstrate HIPAA compliance readiness
- Interface demonstrates sensitivity appropriate for grief support context

Technical Considerations:
- Database schema supports historical tracking and reporting queries
- Integration points identified for EHR/patient records system if applicable
- Backup and disaster recovery procedures for sensitive data
- Data retention policy implementation (how long cases remain active vs archived)
